name: Holodomor (Ukrainian Famine)
description: The Soviet-engineered famine in Ukraine caused by forced collectivization and grain requisitions. Stalin's policies deliberately targeted Ukrainian peasants, confiscating all food and blocking relief. An estimated 3.5-7 million Ukrainians starved to death in 1932-33.

mortality.note: Estimates vary widely. Soviet archives were sealed. Some historians count 3.5M, others up to 10M including birth deficit.

rationales.systematic_intensity: Grain requisitions, internal passports preventing escape, blacklisted villages. Deliberate policy.
rationales.profit: Grain exports continued during famine. Industrialization funded by extracted agricultural surplus.
rationales.ideology: Class warfare against 'kulaks' combined with suppression of Ukrainian nationalism.
rationales.complicity: Soviet officials enforced quotas. Western intellectuals denied famine. Russia still denies genocide.

analysis.pattern_note: Grain quotas enforced while millions starved. Blacklisted villages sealed off. Demonstrates how ideology ('destroy the kulaks as a class') combined with economic extraction (grain exports) creates famine. Still denied by Russia.
analysis.root_causes: Stalinist collectivization, suppression of Ukrainian nationalism, ideological rigidity

sources.title: Bloodlands: Europe Between Hitler and Stalin
sources.author: Timothy Snyder
